page.title: 12Residential Building,The Lee
page.content: Most of the buildings in the block were owned by the Liberty family until 1952. Many houses & farms were sold on the death of Captain Stewart-Liberty, & in a short time the village was mostly owned, not tenant-occupied. There are about 24 council houses in Lee Common, built in 1945. The buildings are {distributed}in 4 centres; The Lee, Swan Bottom, Kings Ash and Lee Common, the last being the largest. {Planning}The area is in the Chiltern AONB, & is a conservation area. Since 1945 little building (70 houses) has been done, only replacement or infilling. As cottages have been sold, they have been enlarged or improved. Cost eg 1952, Â£500; 1985, Â£120,000. A few old{barns}have been converted to dwellings, as modern farms do not need so many buildings.
